verses.text: "Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Have you come to inquire of me? As surely as I live, I will not let you inquire of me, declares the Sovereign LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:4
verses.text: "Will you judge them? Will you judge them, son of man? Then confront them with the detestable practices of their fathers

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:5
verses.text: and say to them: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: On the day I chose Israel, I swore with uplifted hand to the descendants of the house of Jacob and revealed myself to them in Egypt. With uplifted hand I said to them, "I am the LORD your God."

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:6
verses.text: On that day I swore to them that I would bring them out of Egypt into a land I had searched out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most beautiful of all lands.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:7
verses.text: And I said to them, "Each of you, get rid of the vile images you have set your eyes on, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am the LORD your God."

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:8
verses.text: "'But they rebelled against me and would not listen to me; they did not get rid of the vile images they had set their eyes on, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. So I said I would pour out my wrath on them and spend my anger against them in Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:9
verses.text: But for the sake of my name I did what would keep it from being profaned in the eyes of the nations they lived among and in whose sight I had revealed myself to the Israelites by bringing them out of Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:10
verses.text: Therefore I led them out of Egypt and brought them into the desert.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:11
verses.text: I gave them my decrees and made known to them my laws, for the man who obeys them will live by them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:12
verses.text: Also I gave them my Sabbaths as a sign between us, so they would know that I the LORD made them holy.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:13
verses.text: "'Yet the people of Israel rebelled against me in the desert. They did not follow my decrees but rejected my laws-although the man who obeys them will live by them-and they utterly desecrated my Sabbaths. So I said I would pour out my wrath on them and destroy them in the desert.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:14
verses.text: But for the sake of my name I did what would keep it from being profaned in the eyes of the nations in whose sight I had brought them out.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:15
verses.text: Also with uplifted hand I swore to them in the desert that I would not bring them into the land I had given them-a land flowing with milk and honey, most beautiful of all lands-

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:16
verses.text: because they rejected my laws and did not follow my decrees and desecrated my Sabbaths. For their hearts were devoted to their idols.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:17
verses.text: Yet I looked on them with pity and did not destroy them or put an end to them in the desert.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:18
verses.text: I said to their children in the desert, "Do not follow the statutes of your fathers or keep their laws or defile yourselves with their idols.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:19
verses.text: I am the LORD your God; follow my decrees and be careful to keep my laws.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:20
verses.text: Keep my Sabbaths holy, that they may be a sign between us. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God."

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:21
verses.text: "'But the children rebelled against me: They did not follow my decrees, they were not careful to keep my laws-although the man who obeys them will live by them-and they desecrated my Sabbaths. So I said I would pour out my wrath on them and spend my anger against them in the desert.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:22
verses.text: But I withheld my hand, and for the sake of my name I did what would keep it from being profaned in the eyes of the nations in whose sight I had brought them out.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:23
verses.text: Also with uplifted hand I swore to them in the desert that I would disperse them among the nations and scatter them through the countries,

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:24
verses.text: because they had not obeyed my laws but had rejected my decrees and desecrated my Sabbaths, and their eyes lusted after their fathers' idols.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:25
verses.text: I also gave them over to statutes that were not good and laws they could not live by;

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:26
verses.text: I let them become defiled through their gifts-the sacrifice of every firstborn -that I might fill them with horror so they would know that I am the LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:27
verses.text: "Therefore, son of man, speak to the people of Israel and say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: In this also your fathers blasphemed me by forsaking me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:28
verses.text: When I brought them into the land I had sworn to give them and they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, there they offered their sacrifices, made offerings that provoked me to anger, presented their fragrant incense and poured out their drink offerings.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:29
verses.text: Then I said to them: What is this high place you go to?'" (It is called Bamah to this day.)

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:30
verses.text: "Therefore say to the house of Israel: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Will you defile yourselves the way your fathers did and lust after their vile images?

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:31
verses.text: When you offer your gifts-the sacrifice of your sons in the fire-you continue to defile yourselves with all your idols to this day. Am I to let you inquire of me, O house of Israel? As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, I will not let you inquire of me.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:32
verses.text: "'You say, "We want to be like the nations, like the peoples of the world, who serve wood and stone." But what you have in mind will never happen.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:33
verses.text: As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, I will rule over you with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with outpoured wrath.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:34
verses.text: I will bring you from the nations and gather you from the countries where you have been scattered-with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with outpoured wrath.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:35
verses.text: I will bring you into the desert of the nations and there, face to face, I will execute judgment upon you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:36
verses.text: As I judged your fathers in the desert of the land of Egypt, so I will judge you, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:37
verses.text: I will take note of you as you pass under my rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:38
verses.text: I will purge you of those who revolt and rebel against me. Although I will bring them out of the land where they are living, yet they will not enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:39
verses.text: "'As for you, O house of Israel, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Go and serve your idols, every one of you! But afterward you will surely listen to me and no longer profane my holy name with your gifts and idols.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:40
verses.text: For on my holy mountain, the high mountain of Israel, declares the Sovereign LORD, there in the land the entire house of Israel will serve me, and there I will accept them. There I will require your offerings and your choice gifts, along with all your holy sacrifices.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:41
verses.text: I will accept you as fragrant incense when I bring you out from the nations and gather you from the countries where you have been scattered, and I will show myself holy among you in the sight of the nations.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:42
verses.text: Then you will know that I am the LORD, when I bring you into the land of Israel, the land I had sworn with uplifted hand to give to your fathers.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:43
verses.text: There you will remember your conduct and all the actions by which you have defiled yourselves, and you will loathe yourselves for all the evil you have done.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:44
verses.text: You will know that I am the LORD, when I deal with you for my name's sake and not according to your evil ways and your corrupt practices, O house of Israel, declares the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:45
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:46
verses.text: "Son of man, set your face toward the south; preach against the south and prophesy against the forest of the southland.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:47
verses.text: Say to the southern forest: 'Hear the word of the LORD. This is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am about to set fire to you, and it will consume all your trees, both green and dry. The blazing flame will not be quenched, and every face from south to north will be scorched by it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:48
verses.text: Everyone will see that I the LORD have kindled it; it will not be quenched.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 20:49
verses.text: Then I said, "Ah, Sovereign LORD! They are saying of me, 'Isn't he just telling parables?'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:2
verses.text: "Son of man, set your face against Jerusalem and preach against the sanctuary. Prophesy against the land of Israel

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:3
verses.text: and say to her: 'This is what the LORD says: I am against you. I will draw my sword from its scabbard and cut off from you both the righteous and the wicked.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:4
verses.text: Because I am going to cut off the righteous and the wicked, my sword will be unsheathed against everyone from south to north.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:5
verses.text: Then all people will know that I the LORD have drawn my sword from its scabbard; it will not return again.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:6
verses.text: "Therefore groan, son of man! Groan before them with broken heart and bitter grief.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:7
verses.text: And when they ask you, 'Why are you groaning?' you shall say, 'Because of the news that is coming. Every heart will melt and every hand go limp; every spirit will become faint and every knee become as weak as water.' It is coming! It will surely take place, declares the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:8
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:9
verses.text: "Son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Lord says: "'A sword, a sword, sharpened and polished-

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:10
verses.text: sharpened for the slaughter, polished to flash like lightning! "'Shall we rejoice in the scepter of my son Judah? The sword despises every such stick.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:11
verses.text: "'The sword is appointed to be polished, to be grasped with the hand; it is sharpened and polished, made ready for the hand of the slayer.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:12
verses.text: Cry out and wail, son of man, for it is against my people; it is against all the princes of Israel. They are thrown to the sword along with my people. Therefore beat your breast.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:13
verses.text: "'Testing will surely come. And what if the scepter of Judah, which the sword despises, does not continue? declares the Sovereign LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:14
verses.text: "So then, son of man, prophesy and strike your hands together. Let the sword strike twice, even three times. It is a sword for slaughter- a sword for great slaughter, closing in on them from every side.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:15
verses.text: So that hearts may melt and the fallen be many, I have stationed the sword for slaughter at all their gates. Oh! It is made to flash like lightning, it is grasped for slaughter.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:16
verses.text: O sword, slash to the right, then to the left, wherever your blade is turned.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:17
verses.text: I too will strike my hands together, and my wrath will subside. I the LORD have spoken."

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:18
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:19
verses.text: "Son of man, mark out two roads for the sword of the king of Babylon to take, both starting from the same country. Make a signpost where the road branches off to the city.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:20
verses.text: Mark out one road for the sword to come against Rabbah of the Ammonites and another against Judah and fortified Jerusalem.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:21
verses.text: For the king of Babylon will stop at the fork in the road, at the junction of the two roads, to seek an omen: He will cast lots with arrows, he will consult his idols, he will examine the liver.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:22
verses.text: Into his right hand will come the lot for Jerusalem, where he is to set up battering rams, to give the command to slaughter, to sound the battle cry, to set battering rams against the gates, to build a ramp and to erect siege works.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:23
verses.text: It will seem like a false omen to those who have sworn allegiance to him, but he will remind them of their guilt and take them captive.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:24
verses.text: "Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: 'Because you people have brought to mind your guilt by your open rebellion, revealing your sins in all that you do-because you have done this, you will be taken captive.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:25
verses.text: "'O profane and wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come, whose time of punishment has reached its climax,

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:26
verses.text: this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Take off the turban, remove the crown. It will not be as it was: The lowly will be exalted and the exalted will be brought low.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:27
verses.text: A ruin! A ruin! I will make it a ruin! It will not be restored until he comes to whom it rightfully belongs; to him I will give it.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:28
verses.text: "And you, son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says about the Ammonites and their insults: "'A sword, a sword, drawn for the slaughter, polished to consume and to flash like lightning!

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:29
verses.text: Despite false visions concerning you and lying divinations about you, it will be laid on the necks of the wicked who are to be slain, whose day has come, whose time of punishment has reached its climax.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:30
verses.text: Return the sword to its scabbard. In the place where you were created, in the land of your ancestry, I will judge you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:31
verses.text: I will pour out my wrath upon you and breathe out my fiery anger against you; I will hand you over to brutal men, men skilled in destruction.

verses.name: Ezekiel 21:32
verses.text: You will be fuel for the fire, your blood will be shed in your land, you will be remembered no more; for I the LORD have spoken.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:2
verses.text: "Son of man, will you judge her? Will you judge this city of bloodshed? Then confront her with all her detestable practices

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:3
verses.text: and say: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: O city that brings on herself doom by shedding blood in her midst and defiles herself by making idols,

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:4
verses.text: you have become guilty because of the blood you have shed and have become defiled by the idols you have made. You have brought your days to a close, and the end of your years has come. Therefore I will make you an object of scorn to the nations and a laughingstock to all the countries.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:5
verses.text: Those who are near and those who are far away will mock you, O infamous city, full of turmoil.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:6
verses.text: "'See how each of the princes of Israel who are in you uses his power to shed blood.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:7
verses.text: In you they have treated father and mother with contempt; in you they have oppressed the alien and mistreated the fatherless and the widow.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:8
verses.text: You have despised my holy things and desecrated my Sabbaths.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:9
verses.text: In you are slanderous men bent on shedding blood; in you are those who eat at the mountain shrines and commit lewd acts.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:10
verses.text: In you are those who dishonor their fathers' bed; in you are those who violate women during their period, when they are ceremonially unclean.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:11
verses.text: In you one man commits a detestable offense with his neighbor's wife, another shamefully defiles his daughter-in-law, and another violates his sister, his own father's daughter.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:12
verses.text: In you men accept bribes to shed blood; you take usury and excessive interest and make unjust gain from your neighbors by extortion. And you have forgotten me, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:13
verses.text: "'I will surely strike my hands together at the unjust gain you have made and at the blood you have shed in your midst.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:14
verses.text: Will your courage endure or your hands be strong in the day I deal with you? I the LORD have spoken, and I will do it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:15
verses.text: I will disperse you among the nations and scatter you through the countries; and I will put an end to your uncleanness.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:16
verses.text: When you have been defiled in the eyes of the nations, you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:17
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:18
verses.text: "Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me; all of them are the copper, tin, iron and lead left inside a furnace. They are but the dross of silver.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:19
verses.text: Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: 'Because you have all become dross, I will gather you into Jerusalem.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:20
verses.text: As men gather silver, copper, iron, lead and tin into a furnace to melt it with a fiery blast, so will I gather you in my anger and my wrath and put you inside the city and melt you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:21
verses.text: I will gather you and I will blow on you with my fiery wrath, and you will be melted inside her.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:22
verses.text: As silver is melted in a furnace, so you will be melted inside her, and you will know that I the LORD have poured out my wrath upon you.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:23
verses.text: Again the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:24
verses.text: "Son of man, say to the land, 'You are a land that has had no rain or showers in the day of wrath.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:25
verses.text: There is a conspiracy of her princes within her like a roaring lion tearing its prey; they devour people, take treasures and precious things and make many widows within her.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:26
verses.text: Her priests do violence to my law and profane my holy things; they do not distinguish between the holy and the common; they teach that there is no difference between the unclean and the clean; and they shut their eyes to the keeping of my Sabbaths, so that I am profaned among them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:27
verses.text: Her officials within her are like wolves tearing their prey; they shed blood and kill people to make unjust gain.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:28
verses.text: Her prophets whitewash these deeds for them by false visions and lying divinations. They say, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says'-when the LORD has not spoken.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:29
verses.text: The people of the land practice extortion and commit robbery; they oppress the poor and needy and mistreat the alien, denying them justice.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:30
verses.text: "I looked for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand before me in the gap on behalf of the land so I would not have to destroy it, but I found none.

verses.name: Ezekiel 22:31
verses.text: So I will pour out my wrath on them and consume them with my fiery anger, bringing down on their own heads all they have done, declares the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:2
verses.text: "Son of man, there were two women, daughters of the same mother.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:3
verses.text: They became prostitutes in Egypt, engaging in prostitution from their youth. In that land their breasts were fondled and their virgin bosoms caressed.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:4
verses.text: The older was named Oholah, and her sister was Oholibah. They were mine and gave birth to sons and daughters. Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:5
verses.text: "Oholah engaged in prostitution while she was still mine; and she lusted after her lovers, the Assyrians-warriors

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:6
verses.text: clothed in blue, governors and commanders, all of them handsome young men, and mounted horsemen.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:7
verses.text: She gave herself as a prostitute to all the elite of the Assyrians and defiled herself with all the idols of everyone she lusted after.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:8
verses.text: She did not give up the prostitution she began in Egypt, when during her youth men slept with her, caressed her virgin bosom and poured out their lust upon her.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:9
verses.text: "Therefore I handed her over to her lovers, the Assyrians, for whom she lusted.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:10
verses.text: They stripped her naked, took away her sons and daughters and killed her with the sword. She became a byword among women, and punishment was inflicted on her.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:11
verses.text: "Her sister Oholibah saw this, yet in her lust and prostitution she was more depraved than her sister.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:12
verses.text: She too lusted after the Assyrians-governors and commanders, warriors in full dress, mounted horsemen, all handsome young men.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:13
verses.text: I saw that she too defiled herself; both of them went the same way.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:14
verses.text: "But she carried her prostitution still further. She saw men portrayed on a wall, figures of Chaldeans portrayed in red,

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:15
verses.text: with belts around their waists and flowing turbans on their heads; all of them looked like Babylonian chariot officers, natives of Chaldea.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:16
verses.text: As soon as she saw them, she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in Chaldea.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:17
verses.text: Then the Babylonians came to her, to the bed of love, and in their lust they defiled her. After she had been defiled by them, she turned away from them in disgust.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:18
verses.text: When she carried on her prostitution openly and exposed her nakedness, I turned away from her in disgust, just as I had turned away from her sister.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:19
verses.text: Yet she became more and more promiscuous as she recalled the days of her youth, when she was a prostitute in Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:20
verses.text: There she lusted after her lovers, whose genitals were like those of donkeys and whose emission was like that of horses.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:21
verses.text: So you longed for the lewdness of your youth, when in Egypt your bosom was caressed and your young breasts fondled.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:22
verses.text: "Therefore, Oholibah, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will stir up your lovers against you, those you turned away from in disgust, and I will bring them against you from every side-

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:23
verses.text: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, the men of Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them, handsome young men, all of them governors and commanders, chariot officers and men of high rank, all mounted on horses.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:24
verses.text: They will come against you with weapons, chariots and wagons and with a throng of people; they will take up positions against you on every side with large and small shields and with helmets. I will turn you over to them for punishment, and they will punish you according to their standards.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:25
verses.text: I will direct my jealous anger against you, and they will deal with you in fury. They will cut off your noses and your ears, and those of you who are left will fall by the sword. They will take away your sons and daughters, and those of you who are left will be consumed by fire.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:26
verses.text: They will also strip you of your clothes and take your fine jewelry.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:27
verses.text: So I will put a stop to the lewdness and prostitution you began in Egypt. You will not look on these things with longing or remember Egypt anymore.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:28
verses.text: "For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am about to hand you over to those you hate, to those you turned away from in disgust.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:29
verses.text: They will deal with you in hatred and take away everything you have worked for. They will leave you naked and bare, and the shame of your prostitution will be exposed. Your lewdness and promiscuity

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:30
verses.text: have brought this upon you, because you lusted after the nations and defiled yourself with their idols.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:31
verses.text: You have gone the way of your sister; so I will put her cup into your hand.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:32
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "You will drink your sister's cup, a cup large and deep; it will bring scorn and derision, for it holds so much.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:33
verses.text: You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, the cup of ruin and desolation, the cup of your sister Samaria.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:34
verses.text: You will drink it and drain it dry; you will dash it to pieces and tear your breasts. I have spoken, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:35
verses.text: "Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Since you have forgotten me and thrust me behind your back, you must bear the consequences of your lewdness and prostitution."

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:36
verses.text: The LORD said to me: "Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then confront them with their detestable practices,

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:37
verses.text: for they have committed adultery and blood is on their hands. They committed adultery with their idols; they even sacrificed their children, whom they bore to me, as food for them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:38
verses.text: They have also done this to me: At that same time they defiled my sanctuary and desecrated my Sabbaths.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:39
verses.text: On the very day they sacrificed their children to their idols, they entered my sanctuary and desecrated it. That is what they did in my house.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:40
verses.text: "They even sent messengers for men who came from far away, and when they arrived you bathed yourself for them, painted your eyes and put on your jewelry.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:41
verses.text: You sat on an elegant couch, with a table spread before it on which you had placed the incense and oil that belonged to me.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:42
verses.text: "The noise of a carefree crowd was around her; Sabeans were brought from the desert along with men from the rabble, and they put bracelets on the arms of the woman and her sister and beautiful crowns on their heads.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:43
verses.text: Then I said about the one worn out by adultery, 'Now let them use her as a prostitute, for that is all she is.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:44
verses.text: And they slept with her. As men sleep with a prostitute, so they slept with those lewd women, Oholah and Oholibah.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:45
verses.text: But righteous men will sentence them to the punishment of women who commit adultery and shed blood, because they are adulterous and blood is on their hands.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:46
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Bring a mob against them and give them over to terror and plunder.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:47
verses.text: The mob will stone them and cut them down with their swords; they will kill their sons and daughters and burn down their houses.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:48
verses.text: "So I will put an end to lewdness in the land, that all women may take warning and not imitate you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 23:49
verses.text: You will suffer the penalty for your lewdness and bear the consequences of your sins of idolatry. Then you will know that I am the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:1
verses.text: In the ninth year, in the tenth month on the tenth day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:2
verses.text: "Son of man, record this date, this very date, because the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:3
verses.text: Tell this rebellious house a parable and say to them: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'Put on the cooking pot; put it on and pour water into it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:4
verses.text: Put into it the pieces of meat, all the choice pieces-the leg and the shoulder. Fill it with the best of these bones;

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:5
verses.text: take the pick of the flock. Pile wood beneath it for the bones; bring it to a boil and cook the bones in it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:6
verses.text: "'For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'Woe to the city of bloodshed, to the pot now encrusted, whose deposit will not go away! Empty it piece by piece without casting lots for them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:7
verses.text: "'For the blood she shed is in her midst: She poured it on the bare rock; she did not pour it on the ground, where the dust would cover it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:8
verses.text: To stir up wrath and take revenge I put her blood on the bare rock, so that it would not be covered.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:9
verses.text: "'Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'Woe to the city of bloodshed! I, too, will pile the wood high.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:10
verses.text: So heap on the wood and kindle the fire. Cook the meat well, mixing in the spices; and let the bones be charred.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:11
verses.text: Then set the empty pot on the coals till it becomes hot and its copper glows so its impurities may be melted and its deposit burned away.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:12
verses.text: It has frustrated all efforts; its heavy deposit has not been removed, not even by fire.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:13
verses.text: "'Now your impurity is lewdness. Because I tried to cleanse you but you would not be cleansed from your impurity, you will not be clean again until my wrath against you has subsided.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:14
verses.text: "'I the LORD have spoken. The time has come for me to act. I will not hold back; I will not have pity, nor will I relent. You will be judged according to your conduct and your actions, declares the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:15
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:16
verses.text: "Son of man, with one blow I am about to take away from you the delight of your eyes. Yet do not lament or weep or shed any tears.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:17
verses.text: Groan quietly; do not mourn for the dead. Keep your turban fastened and your sandals on your feet; do not cover the lower part of your face or eat the customary food of mourners."

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:18
verses.text: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. The next morning I did as I had been commanded.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:19
verses.text: Then the people asked me, "Won't you tell us what these things have to do with us?"

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:20
verses.text: So I said to them, "The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:21
verses.text: Say to the house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am about to desecrate my sanctuary-the stronghold in which you take pride, the delight of your eyes, the object of your affection. The sons and daughters you left behind will fall by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:22
verses.text: And you will do as I have done. You will not cover the lower part of your face or eat the customary food of mourners.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:23
verses.text: You will keep your turbans on your heads and your sandals on your feet. You will not mourn or weep but will waste away because of your sins and groan among yourselves.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:24
verses.text: Ezekiel will be a sign to you; you will do just as he has done. When this happens, you will know that I am the Sovereign LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:25
verses.text: "And you, son of man, on the day I take away their stronghold, their joy and glory, the delight of their eyes, their heart's desire, and their sons and daughters as well-

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:26
verses.text: on that day a fugitive will come to tell you the news.

verses.name: Ezekiel 24:27
verses.text: At that time your mouth will be opened; you will speak with him and will no longer be silent. So you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:2
verses.text: "Son of man, set your face against the Ammonites and prophesy against them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:3
verses.text: Say to them, 'Hear the word of the Sovereign LORD. This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Because you said "Aha!" over my sanctuary when it was desecrated and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste and over the people of Judah when they went into exile,

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:4
verses.text: therefore I am going to give you to the people of the East as a possession. They will set up their camps and pitch their tents among you; they will eat your fruit and drink your milk.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:5
verses.text: I will turn Rabbah into a pasture for camels and Ammon into a resting place for sheep. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:6
verses.text: For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Because you have clapped your hands and stamped your feet, rejoicing with all the malice of your heart against the land of Israel,

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:7
verses.text: therefore I will stretch out my hand against you and give you as plunder to the nations. I will cut you off from the nations and exterminate you from the countries. I will destroy you, and you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:8
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: 'Because Moab and Seir said, "Look, the house of Judah has become like all the other nations,"

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:9
verses.text: therefore I will expose the flank of Moab, beginning at its frontier towns-Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon and Kiriathaim-the glory of that land.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:10
verses.text: I will give Moab along with the Ammonites to the people of the East as a possession, so that the Ammonites will not be remembered among the nations;

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:11
verses.text: and I will inflict punishment on Moab. Then they will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:12
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: 'Because Edom took revenge on the house of Judah and became very guilty by doing so,

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:13
verses.text: therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will stretch out my hand against Edom and kill its men and their animals. I will lay it waste, and from Teman to Dedan they will fall by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:14
verses.text: I will take vengeance on Edom by the hand of my people Israel, and they will deal with Edom in accordance with my anger and my wrath; they will know my vengeance, declares the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:15
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: 'Because the Philistines acted in vengeance and took revenge with malice in their hearts, and with ancient hostility sought to destroy Judah,

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:16
verses.text: therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am about to stretch out my hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Kerethites and destroy those remaining along the coast.

verses.name: Ezekiel 25:17
verses.text: I will carry out great vengeance on them and punish them in my wrath. Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I take vengeance on them.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:1
verses.text: In the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:2
verses.text: "Son of man, because Tyre has said of Jerusalem, 'Aha! The gate to the nations is broken, and its doors have swung open to me; now that she lies in ruins I will prosper,'

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:3
verses.text: therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am against you, O Tyre, and I will bring many nations against you, like the sea casting up its waves.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:4
verses.text: They will destroy the walls of Tyre and pull down her towers; I will scrape away her rubble and make her a bare rock.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:5
verses.text: Out in the sea she will become a place to spread fishnets, for I have spoken, declares the Sovereign LORD. She will become plunder for the nations,

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:6
verses.text: and her settlements on the mainland will be ravaged by the sword. Then they will know that I am the LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:7
verses.text: "For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: From the north I am going to bring against Tyre Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses and chariots, with horsemen and a great army.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:8
verses.text: He will ravage your settlements on the mainland with the sword; he will set up siege works against you, build a ramp up to your walls and raise his shields against you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:9
verses.text: He will direct the blows of his battering rams against your walls and demolish your towers with his weapons.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:10
verses.text: His horses will be so many that they will cover you with dust. Your walls will tremble at the noise of the war horses, wagons and chariots when he enters your gates as men enter a city whose walls have been broken through.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:11
verses.text: The hoofs of his horses will trample all your streets; he will kill your people with the sword, and your strong pillars will fall to the ground.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:12
verses.text: They will plunder your wealth and loot your merchandise; they will break down your walls and demolish your fine houses and throw your stones, timber and rubble into the sea.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:13
verses.text: I will put an end to your noisy songs, and the music of your harps will be heard no more.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:14
verses.text: I will make you a bare rock, and you will become a place to spread fishnets. You will never be rebuilt, for I the LORD have spoken, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:15
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says to Tyre: Will not the coastlands tremble at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan and the slaughter takes place in you?

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:16
verses.text: Then all the princes of the coast will step down from their thrones and lay aside their robes and take off their embroidered garments. Clothed with terror, they will sit on the ground, trembling every moment, appalled at you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:17
verses.text: Then they will take up a lament concerning you and say to you: "'How you are destroyed, O city of renown, peopled by men of the sea! You were a power on the seas, you and your citizens; you put your terror on all who lived there.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:18
verses.text: Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your fall; the islands in the sea are terrified at your collapse.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:19
verses.text: "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: When I make you a desolate city, like cities no longer inhabited, and when I bring the ocean depths over you and its vast waters cover you,

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:20
verses.text: then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of long ago. I will make you dwell in the earth below, as in ancient ruins, with those who go down to the pit, and you will not return or take your place in the land of the living.

verses.name: Ezekiel 26:21
verses.text: I will bring you to a horrible end and you will be no more. You will be sought, but you will never again be found, declares the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:2
verses.text: "Son of man, take up a lament concerning Tyre.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:3
verses.text: Say to Tyre, situated at the gateway to the sea, merchant of peoples on many coasts, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'You say, O Tyre, "I am perfect in beauty."

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:4
verses.text: Your domain was on the high seas; your builders brought your beauty to perfection.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:5
verses.text: They made all your timbers of pine trees from Senir; they took a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:6
verses.text: Of oaks from Bashan they made your oars; of cypress wood from the coasts of Cyprus they made your deck, inlaid with ivory.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:7
verses.text: Fine embroidered linen from Egypt was your sail and served as your banner; your awnings were of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:8
verses.text: Men of Sidon and Arvad were your oarsmen; your skilled men, O Tyre, were aboard as your seamen.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:9
verses.text: Veteran craftsmen of Gebal were on board as shipwrights to caulk your seams. All the ships of the sea and their sailors came alongside to trade for your wares.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:10
verses.text: "'Men of Persia, Lydia and Put served as soldiers in your army. They hung their shields and helmets on your walls, bringing you splendor.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:11
verses.text: Men of Arvad and Helech manned your walls on every side; men of Gammad were in your towers. They hung their shields around your walls; they brought your beauty to perfection.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:12
verses.text: "'Tarshish did business with you because of your great wealth of goods; they exchanged silver, iron, tin and lead for your merchandise.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:13
verses.text: "'Greece, Tubal and Meshech traded with you; they exchanged slaves and articles of bronze for your wares.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:14
verses.text: "'Men of Beth Togarmah exchanged work horses, war horses and mules for your merchandise.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:15
verses.text: "'The men of Rhodes traded with you, and many coastlands were your customers; they paid you with ivory tusks and ebony.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:16
verses.text: "'Aram did business with you because of your many products; they exchanged turquoise, purple fabric, embroidered work, fine linen, coral and rubies for your merchandise.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:17
verses.text: "'Judah and Israel traded with you; they exchanged wheat from Minnith and confections, honey, oil and balm for your wares.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:18
verses.text: "'Damascus, because of your many products and great wealth of goods, did business with you in wine from Helbon and wool from Zahar.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:19
verses.text: "'Danites and Greeks from Uzal bought your merchandise; they exchanged wrought iron, cassia and calamus for your wares.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:20
verses.text: "'Dedan traded in saddle blankets with you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:21
verses.text: "'Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your customers; they did business with you in lambs, rams and goats.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:22
verses.text: "'The merchants of Sheba and Raamah traded with you; for your merchandise they exchanged the finest of all kinds of spices and precious stones, and gold.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:23
verses.text: "'Haran, Canneh and Eden and merchants of Sheba, Asshur and Kilmad traded with you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:24
verses.text: In your marketplace they traded with you beautiful garments, blue fabric, embroidered work and multicolored rugs with cords twisted and tightly knotted.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:25
verses.text: "'The ships of Tarshish serve as carriers for your wares. You are filled with heavy cargo in the heart of the sea.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:26
verses.text: Your oarsmen take you out to the high seas. But the east wind will break you to pieces in the heart of the sea.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:27
verses.text: Your wealth, merchandise and wares, your mariners, seamen and shipwrights, your merchants and all your soldiers, and everyone else on board will sink into the heart of the sea on the day of your shipwreck.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:28
verses.text: The shorelands will quake when your seamen cry out.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:29
verses.text: All who handle the oars will abandon their ships; the mariners and all the seamen will stand on the shore.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:30
verses.text: They will raise their voice and cry bitterly over you; they will sprinkle dust on their heads and roll in ashes.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:31
verses.text: They will shave their heads because of you and will put on sackcloth. They will weep over you with anguish of soul and with bitter mourning.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:32
verses.text: As they wail and mourn over you, they will take up a lament concerning you: "Who was ever silenced like Tyre, surrounded by the sea?"

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:33
verses.text: When your merchandise went out on the seas, you satisfied many nations; with your great wealth and your wares you enriched the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:34
verses.text: Now you are shattered by the sea in the depths of the waters; your wares and all your company have gone down with you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:35
verses.text: All who live in the coastlands are appalled at you; their kings shudder with horror and their faces are distorted with fear.

verses.name: Ezekiel 27:36
verses.text: The merchants among the nations hiss at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:2
verses.text: "Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'In the pride of your heart you say, "I am a god; I sit on the throne of a god in the heart of the seas." But you are a man and not a god, though you think you are as wise as a god.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:3
verses.text: Are you wiser than Daniel? Is no secret hidden from you?

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:4
verses.text: By your wisdom and understanding you have gained wealth for yourself and amassed gold and silver in your treasuries.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:5
verses.text: By your great skill in trading you have increased your wealth, and because of your wealth your heart has grown proud.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:6
verses.text: "'Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'Because you think you are wise, as wise as a god,

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:7
verses.text: I am going to bring foreigners against you, the most ruthless of nations; they will draw their swords against your beauty and wisdom and pierce your shining splendor.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:8
verses.text: They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:9
verses.text: Will you then say, "I am a god," in the presence of those who kill you? You will be but a man, not a god, in the hands of those who slay you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:10
verses.text: You will die the death of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. I have spoken, declares the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:11
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:12
verses.text: "Son of man, take up a lament concerning the king of Tyre and say to him: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'You were the model of perfection, full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:13
verses.text: You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone adorned you: ruby, topaz and emerald, chrysolite, onyx and jasper, sapphire, turquoise and beryl. Your settings and mountings were made of gold; on the day you were created they were prepared.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:14
verses.text: You were anointed as a guardian cherub, for so I ordained you. You were on the holy mount of God; you walked among the fiery stones.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:15
verses.text: You were blameless in your ways from the day you were created till wickedness was found in you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:16
verses.text: Through your widespread trade you were filled with violence, and you sinned. So I drove you in disgrace from the mount of God, and I expelled you, O guardian cherub, from among the fiery stones.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:17
verses.text: Your heart became proud on account of your beauty, and you corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor. So I threw you to the earth; I made a spectacle of you before kings.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:18
verses.text: By your many sins and dishonest trade you have desecrated your sanctuaries. So I made a fire come out from you, and it consumed you, and I reduced you to ashes on the ground in the sight of all who were watching.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:19
verses.text: All the nations who knew you are appalled at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:20
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:21
verses.text: "Son of man, set your face against Sidon; prophesy against her

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:22
verses.text: and say: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'I am against you, O Sidon, and I will gain glory within you. They will know that I am the LORD, when I inflict punishment on her and show myself holy within her.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:23
verses.text: I will send a plague upon her and make blood flow in her streets. The slain will fall within her, with the sword against her on every side. Then they will know that I am the LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:24
verses.text: "'No longer will the people of Israel have malicious neighbors who are painful briers and sharp thorns. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:25
verses.text: "'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: When I gather the people of Israel from the nations where they have been scattered, I will show myself holy among them in the sight of the nations. Then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.

verses.name: Ezekiel 28:26
verses.text: They will live there in safety and will build houses and plant vineyards; they will live in safety when I inflict punishment on all their neighbors who maligned them. Then they will know that I am the LORD their God.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:1
verses.text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month on the twelfth day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:2
verses.text: "Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:3
verses.text: Speak to him and say: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, you great monster lying among your streams. You say, "The Nile is mine; I made it for myself."

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:4
verses.text: But I will put hooks in your jaws and make the fish of your streams stick to your scales. I will pull you out from among your streams, with all the fish sticking to your scales.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:5
verses.text: I will leave you in the desert, you and all the fish of your streams. You will fall on the open field and not be gathered or picked up. I will give you as food to the beasts of the earth and the birds of the air.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:6
verses.text: Then all who live in Egypt will know that I am the LORD. "'You have been a staff of reed for the house of Israel.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:7
verses.text: When they grasped you with their hands, you splintered and you tore open their shoulders; when they leaned on you, you broke and their backs were wrenched.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:8
verses.text: "'Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will bring a sword against you and kill your men and their animals.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:9
verses.text: Egypt will become a desolate wasteland. Then they will know that I am the LORD. "'Because you said, "The Nile is mine; I made it,"

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:10
verses.text: therefore I am against you and against your streams, and I will make the land of Egypt a ruin and a desolate waste from Migdol to Aswan, as far as the border of Cush.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:11
verses.text: No foot of man or animal will pass through it; no one will live there for forty years.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:12
verses.text: I will make the land of Egypt desolate among devastated lands, and her cities will lie desolate forty years among ruined cities. And I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:13
verses.text: "'Yet this is what the Sovereign LORD says: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:14
verses.text: I will bring them back from captivity and return them to Upper Egypt, the land of their ancestry. There they will be a lowly kingdom.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:15
verses.text: It will be the lowliest of kingdoms and will never again exalt itself above the other nations. I will make it so weak that it will never again rule over the nations.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:16
verses.text: Egypt will no longer be a source of confidence for the people of Israel but will be a reminder of their sin in turning to her for help. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:17
verses.text: In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month on the first day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:18
verses.text: "Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon drove his army in a hard campaign against Tyre; every head was rubbed bare and every shoulder made raw. Yet he and his army got no reward from the campaign he led against Tyre.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:19
verses.text: Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am going to give Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will carry off its wealth. He will loot and plunder the land as pay for his army.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:20
verses.text: I have given him Egypt as a reward for his efforts because he and his army did it for me, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 29:21
verses.text: "On that day I will make a horn grow for the house of Israel, and I will open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am the LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:2
verses.text: "Son of man, prophesy and say: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'Wail and say, "Alas for that day!"

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:3
verses.text: For the day is near, the day of the LORD is near- a day of clouds, a time of doom for the nations.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:4
verses.text: A sword will come against Egypt, and anguish will come upon Cush. When the slain fall in Egypt, her wealth will be carried away and her foundations torn down.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:5
verses.text: Cush and Put, Lydia and all Arabia, Libya and the people of the covenant land will fall by the sword along with Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:6
verses.text: "'This is what the LORD says: "'The allies of Egypt will fall and her proud strength will fail. From Migdol to Aswan they will fall by the sword within her, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:7
verses.text: "'They will be desolate among desolate lands, and their cities will lie among ruined cities.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:8
verses.text: Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I set fire to Egypt and all her helpers are crushed.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:9
verses.text: "'On that day messengers will go out from me in ships to frighten Cush out of her complacency. Anguish will take hold of them on the day of Egypt's doom, for it is sure to come.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:10
verses.text: "'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'I will put an end to the hordes of Egypt by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:11
verses.text: He and his army-the most ruthless of nations- will be brought in to destroy the land. They will draw their swords against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:12
verses.text: I will dry up the streams of the Nile and sell the land to evil men; by the hand of foreigners I will lay waste the land and everything in it. I the LORD have spoken.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:13
verses.text: "'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'I will destroy the idols and put an end to the images in Memphis. No longer will there be a prince in Egypt, and I will spread fear throughout the land.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:14
verses.text: I will lay waste Upper Egypt, set fire to Zoan and inflict punishment on Thebes.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:15
verses.text: I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the stronghold of Egypt, and cut off the hordes of Thebes.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:16
verses.text: I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium will writhe in agony. Thebes will be taken by storm; Memphis will be in constant distress.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:17
verses.text: The young men of Heliopolis and Bubastis will fall by the sword, and the cities themselves will go into captivity.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:18
verses.text: Dark will be the day at Tahpanhes when I break the yoke of Egypt; there her proud strength will come to an end. She will be covered with clouds, and her villages will go into captivity.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:19
verses.text: So I will inflict punishment on Egypt, and they will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:20
verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the first month on the seventh day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:21
verses.text: "Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. It has not been bound up for healing or put in a splint so as to become strong enough to hold a sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:22
verses.text: Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break both his arms, the good arm as well as the broken one, and make the sword fall from his hand.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:23
verses.text: I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:24
verses.text: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him like a mortally wounded man.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:25
verses.text: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall limp. Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he brandishes it against Egypt.

verses.name: Ezekiel 30:26
verses.text: I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries. Then they will know that I am the LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:1
verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the third month on the first day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:2
verses.text: "Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes: "'Who can be compared with you in majesty?

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:3
verses.text: Consider Assyria, once a cedar in Lebanon, with beautiful branches overshadowing the forest; it towered on high, its top above the thick foliage.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:4
verses.text: The waters nourished it, deep springs made it grow tall; their streams flowed all around its base and sent their channels to all the trees of the field.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:5
verses.text: So it towered higher than all the trees of the field; its boughs increased and its branches grew long, spreading because of abundant waters.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:6
verses.text: All the birds of the air nested in its boughs, all the beasts of the field gave birth under its branches; all the great nations lived in its shade.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:7
verses.text: It was majestic in beauty, with its spreading boughs, for its roots went down to abundant waters.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:8
verses.text: The cedars in the garden of God could not rival it, nor could the pine trees equal its boughs, nor could the plane trees compare with its branches- no tree in the garden of God could match its beauty.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:9
verses.text: I made it beautiful with abundant branches, the envy of all the trees of Eden in the garden of God.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:10
verses.text: "'Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Because it towered on high, lifting its top above the thick foliage, and because it was proud of its height,

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:11
verses.text: I handed it over to the ruler of the nations, for him to deal with according to its wickedness. I cast it aside,

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:12
verses.text: and the most ruthless of foreign nations cut it down and left it. Its boughs fell on the mountains and in all the valleys; its branches lay broken in all the ravines of the land. All the nations of the earth came out from under its shade and left it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:13
verses.text: All the birds of the air settled on the fallen tree, and all the beasts of the field were among its branches.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:14
verses.text: Therefore no other trees by the waters are ever to tower proudly on high, lifting their tops above the thick foliage. No other trees so well-watered are ever to reach such a height; they are all destined for death, for the earth below, among mortal men, with those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:15
verses.text: "'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: On the day it was brought down to the grave I covered the deep springs with mourning for it; I held back its streams, and its abundant waters were restrained. Because of it I clothed Lebanon with gloom, and all the trees of the field withered away.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:16
verses.text: I made the nations tremble at the sound of its fall when I brought it down to the grave with those who go down to the pit. Then all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, all the trees that were well-watered, were consoled in the earth below.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:17
verses.text: Those who lived in its shade, its allies among the nations, had also gone down to the grave with it, joining those killed by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 31:18
verses.text: "'Which of the trees of Eden can be compared with you in splendor and majesty? Yet you, too, will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the earth below; you will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword. "'This is Pharaoh and all his hordes, declares the Sovereign LORD.'"

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:1
verses.text: In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month on the first day, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:2
verses.text: "Son of man, take up a lament concerning Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him: "'You are like a lion among the nations; you are like a monster in the seas thrashing about in your streams, churning the water with your feet and muddying the streams.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:3
verses.text: "'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'With a great throng of people I will cast my net over you, and they will haul you up in my net.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:4
verses.text: I will throw you on the land and hurl you on the open field. I will let all the birds of the air settle on you and all the beasts of the earth gorge themselves on you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:5
verses.text: I will spread your flesh on the mountains and fill the valleys with your remains.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:6
verses.text: I will drench the land with your flowing blood all the way to the mountains, and the ravines will be filled with your flesh.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:7
verses.text: When I snuff you out, I will cover the heavens and darken their stars; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon will not give its light.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:8
verses.text: All the shining lights in the heavens I will darken over you; I will bring darkness over your land, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:9
verses.text: I will trouble the hearts of many peoples when I bring about your destruction among the nations, among lands you have not known.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:10
verses.text: I will cause many peoples to be appalled at you, and their kings will shudder with horror because of you when I brandish my sword before them. On the day of your downfall each of them will tremble every moment for his life.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:11
verses.text: "'For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'The sword of the king of Babylon will come against you.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:12
verses.text: I will cause your hordes to fall by the swords of mighty men- the most ruthless of all nations. They will shatter the pride of Egypt, and all her hordes will be overthrown.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:13
verses.text: I will destroy all her cattle from beside abundant waters no longer to be stirred by the foot of man or muddied by the hoofs of cattle.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:14
verses.text: Then I will let her waters settle and make her streams flow like oil, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:15
verses.text: When I make Egypt desolate and strip the land of everything in it, when I strike down all who live there, then they will know that I am the LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:16
verses.text: "This is the lament they will chant for her. The daughters of the nations will chant it; for Egypt and all her hordes they will chant it, declares the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:17
verses.text: In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:18
verses.text: "Son of man, wail for the hordes of Egypt and consign to the earth below both her and the daughters of mighty nations, with those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:19
verses.text: Say to them, 'Are you more favored than others? Go down and be laid among the uncircumcised.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:20
verses.text: They will fall among those killed by the sword. The sword is drawn; let her be dragged off with all her hordes.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:21
verses.text: From within the grave the mighty leaders will say of Egypt and her allies, 'They have come down and they lie with the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:22
verses.text: "Assyria is there with her whole army; she is surrounded by the graves of all her slain, all who have fallen by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:23
verses.text: Their graves are in the depths of the pit and her army lies around her grave. All who had spread terror in the land of the living are slain, fallen by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:24
verses.text: "Elam is there, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are slain, fallen by the sword. All who had spread terror in the land of the living went down uncircumcised to the earth below. They bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:25
verses.text: A bed is made for her among the slain, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword. Because their terror had spread in the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit; they are laid among the slain.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:26
verses.text: "Meshech and Tubal are there, with all their hordes around their graves. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword because they spread their terror in the land of the living.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:27
verses.text: Do they not lie with the other uncircumcised warriors who have fallen, who went down to the grave with their weapons of war, whose swords were placed under their heads? The punishment for their sins rested on their bones, though the terror of these warriors had stalked through the land of the living.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:28
verses.text: "You too, O Pharaoh, will be broken and will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:29
verses.text: "Edom is there, her kings and all her princes; despite their power, they are laid with those killed by the sword. They lie with the uncircumcised, with those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:30
verses.text: "All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there; they went down with the slain in disgrace despite the terror caused by their power. They lie uncircumcised with those killed by the sword and bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:31
verses.text: "Pharaoh-he and all his army-will see them and he will be consoled for all his hordes that were killed by the sword, declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: Ezekiel 32:32
verses.text: Although I had him spread terror in the land of the living, Pharaoh and all his hordes will be laid among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword, declares the Sovereign LORD."

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:2
verses.text: "Son of man, speak to your countrymen and say to them: 'When I bring the sword against a land, and the people of the land choose one of their men and make him their watchman,

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:3
verses.text: and he sees the sword coming against the land and blows the trumpet to warn the people,

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:4
verses.text: then if anyone hears the trumpet but does not take warning and the sword comes and takes his life, his blood will be on his own head.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:5
verses.text: Since he heard the sound of the trumpet but did not take warning, his blood will be on his own head. If he had taken warning, he would have saved himself.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:6
verses.text: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet to warn the people and the sword comes and takes the life of one of them, that man will be taken away because of his sin, but I will hold the watchman accountable for his blood.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:7
verses.text: "Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; so hear the word I speak and give them warning from me.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:8
verses.text: When I say to the wicked, 'O wicked man, you will surely die,' and you do not speak out to dissuade him from his ways, that wicked man will die for his sin, and I will hold you accountable for his blood.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:9
verses.text: But if you do warn the wicked man to turn from his ways and he does not do so, he will die for his sin, but you will have saved yourself.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:10
verses.text: "Son of man, say to the house of Israel, 'This is what you are saying: "Our offenses and sins weigh us down, and we are wasting away because of them. How then can we live?"'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:11
verses.text: Say to them, 'As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live. Turn! Turn from your evil ways! Why will you die, O house of Israel?'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:12
verses.text: "Therefore, son of man, say to your countrymen, 'The righteousness of the righteous man will not save him when he disobeys, and the wickedness of the wicked man will not cause him to fall when he turns from it. The righteous man, if he sins, will not be allowed to live because of his former righteousness.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:13
verses.text: If I tell the righteous man that he will surely live, but then he trusts in his righteousness and does evil, none of the righteous things he has done will be remembered; he will die for the evil he has done.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:14
verses.text: And if I say to the wicked man, 'You will surely die,' but he then turns away from his sin and does what is just and right-

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:15
verses.text: if he gives back what he took in pledge for a loan, returns what he has stolen, follows the decrees that give life, and does no evil, he will surely live; he will not die.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:16
verses.text: None of the sins he has committed will be remembered against him. He has done what is just and right; he will surely live.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:17
verses.text: "Yet your countrymen say, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' But it is their way that is not just.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:18
verses.text: If a righteous man turns from his righteousness and does evil, he will die for it.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:19
verses.text: And if a wicked man turns away from his wickedness and does what is just and right, he will live by doing so.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:20
verses.text: Yet, O house of Israel, you say, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' But I will judge each of you according to his own ways."

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:21
verses.text: In the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month on the fifth day, a man who had escaped from Jerusalem came to me and said, "The city has fallen!"

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:22
verses.text: Now the evening before the man arrived, the hand of the LORD was upon me, and he opened my mouth before the man came to me in the morning. So my mouth was opened and I was no longer silent.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:23
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:24
verses.text: "Son of man, the people living in those ruins in the land of Israel are saying, 'Abraham was only one man, yet he possessed the land. But we are many; surely the land has been given to us as our possession.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:25
verses.text: Therefore say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Since you eat meat with the blood still in it and look to your idols and shed blood, should you then possess the land?

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:26
verses.text: You rely on your sword, you do detestable things, and each of you defiles his neighbor's wife. Should you then possess the land?'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:27
verses.text: "Say this to them: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: As surely as I live, those who are left in the ruins will fall by the sword, those out in the country I will give to the wild animals to be devoured, and those in strongholds and caves will die of a plague.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:28
verses.text: I will make the land a desolate waste, and her proud strength will come to an end, and the mountains of Israel will become desolate so that no one will cross them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:29
verses.text: Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I have made the land a desolate waste because of all the detestable things they have done.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:30
verses.text: "As for you, son of man, your countrymen are talking together about you by the walls and at the doors of the houses, saying to each other, 'Come and hear the message that has come from the LORD.'

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:31
verses.text: My people come to you, as they usually do, and sit before you to listen to your words, but they do not put them into practice. With their mouths they express devotion, but their hearts are greedy for unjust gain.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:32
verses.text: Indeed, to them you are nothing more than one who sings love songs with a beautiful voice and plays an instrument well, for they hear your words but do not put them into practice.

verses.name: Ezekiel 33:33
verses.text: "When all this comes true-and it surely will-then they will know that a prophet has been among them."

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:2
verses.text: "Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy and say to them: 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Woe to the shepherds of Israel who only take care of themselves! Should not shepherds take care of the flock?

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:3
verses.text: You eat the curds, clothe yourselves with the wool and slaughter the choice animals, but you do not take care of the flock.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:4
verses.text: You have not strengthened the weak or healed the sick or bound up the injured. You have not brought back the strays or searched for the lost. You have ruled them harshly and brutally.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:5
verses.text: So they were scattered because there was no shepherd, and when they were scattered they became food for all the wild animals.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:6
verses.text: My sheep wandered over all the mountains and on every high hill. They were scattered over the whole earth, and no one searched or looked for them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:7
verses.text: "'Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD:

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:8
verses.text: As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, because my flock lacks a shepherd and so has been plundered and has become food for all the wild animals, and because my shepherds did not search for my flock but cared for themselves rather than for my flock,

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:9
verses.text: therefore, O shepherds, hear the word of the LORD:

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:10
verses.text: This is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am against the shepherds and will hold them accountable for my flock. I will remove them from tending the flock so that the shepherds can no longer feed themselves. I will rescue my flock from their mouths, and it will no longer be food for them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:11
verses.text: "'For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I myself will search for my sheep and look after them.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:12
verses.text: As a shepherd looks after his scattered flock when he is with them, so will I look after my sheep. I will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered on a day of clouds and darkness.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:13
verses.text: I will bring them out from the nations and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them into their own land. I will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, in the ravines and in all the settlements in the land.

verses.name: Ezekiel 34:14
